publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1846# Alasdair Morgan: Economic Recovery Plan for Dumfries and Galloway—That the Parliament recognises that Dumfries and Galloway has borne the brunt of the fight against foot and mouth disease in Scotland, a fight which has been carried out on behalf of all of Scotland; notes the very severe economic consequences for the area; welcomes the Economic Recovery Plan for Dumfries and Galloway produced by an inter-agency group of public and private bodies and presented to Scottish Ministers on 18 April 2001, and urges the Scottish Executive to support this plan. Supported by: Bruce Crawford*

S1M-1846# Economic Recovery Plan for Dumfries and Galloway (lodged on 19 April 2001) Christine Grahame*, Andrew Wilson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Donald Gorrie*, Tricia Marwick*

S1M-1846# Economic Recovery Plan for Dumfries and Galloway (lodged on 19 April 2001) Mr Murray Tosh*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Michael Matheson*, Alex Fergusson*, Fiona Hyslop*, Robin Harper*, David Mundell*

S1M-1846# Economic Recovery Plan for Dumfries and Galloway (lodged on 19 April 2001) Roseanna Cunningham*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Phil Gallie*, John Scott*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Michael Russell*, Irene McGugan*, Fergus Ewing*, Mr David Davidson*, Bill Aitken*, Nick Johnston*
S1M-1846# Economic Recovery Plan for Dumfries and Galloway (lodged on 19 April 2001) Dr Elaine Murray*, Mr Alex Salmond*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Fiona McLeod*

S1M-1846# Alasdair Morgan: Economic Recovery Plan for Dumfries and Galloway—That the Parliament recognises that Dumfries and Galloway has borne the brunt of the fight against foot and mouth disease in Scotland, a fight which has been carried out on behalf of all of Scotland; notes the very severe economic consequences for the area; welcomes the Economic Recovery Plan for Dumfries and Galloway produced by an inter-agency group of public and private bodies and presented to Scottish Ministers on 18 April 2001, and urges the Scottish Executive to support this plan. Supported by: Bruce Crawford, Christine Grahame, Andrew Wilson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Donald Gorrie, Tricia Marwick, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Matheson, Alex Fergusson, Fiona Hyslop, Robin Harper, David Mundell, Roseanna Cunningham, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Phil Gallie, John Scott, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Michael Russell, Irene McGugan, Fergus Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Bill Aitken, Nick Johnston, Dr Elaine Murray, Mr Alex Salmond, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Fiona McLeod, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*

S1M-1846# Economic Recovery Plan for Dumfries and Galloway (lodged on 19 April 2001) David McLetchie*
